meanings.definition: A thin strip of wood or other material used to level or support a surface.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter placed the furrings beneath the floor to make it even.
meanings.sent2: The ceiling was supported by the furrings to ensure it was level.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat mistook the furrings for a scratching post.
meanings.sent4: The furrings acted like little bridges, connecting the uneven parts of the wall.
meanings.sent5: The furrings were like tiny stepping stones across the room.

meanings.definition: The act of lining or covering with fur.
meanings.sent1: The furrings of the coat gave it a warm and cozy feel.
meanings.sent2: The designer used luxurious furrings to enhance the look of the jacket.
meanings.sent3: The fashion show featured extravagant furrings on all the outfits.
meanings.sent4: The teddy bear's furrings were so soft, like a fluffy cloud.
meanings.sent5: The movie star's glamorous coat had furrings that shimmered under the lights.

meanings.definition: The process of adding a decorative or insulating layer to a surface.
meanings.sent1: The furrings on the walls added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent2: The furrings were essential for keeping the house warm in winter.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the furrings were secret tunnels in their playhouse.
meanings.sent4: The artist used colorful furrings to create a unique pattern on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The furrings transformed the plain wall into a work of art.
